name: Basic Code Sequence
description: This macro specifies the default set of Attributes encapsulated in the Items of Code Sequence Attributes. These Attributes comprise the Code Sequence Macro.

name: Enhanced Code Sequence
description: This macro specifies the default set of Attributes encapsulated in the Items of Code Sequence Attributes. These Attributes comprise the Code Sequence Macro.

name: Code Sequence
description: This macro specifies the default set of Attributes encapsulated in the Items of Code Sequence Attributes. These Attributes comprise the Code Sequence Macro.

name: Person Identification
description: This Macro may be invoked to specify a coded representation of a person such as a healthcare worker, and the organization to which they are responsible.

name: Content Item
description: A Content Item is a flexible means of encoding attribute identifiers and attribute values using the Code Sequence Macro (see This macro ) for coded terminology defined by a coding scheme. The Content Item provides a name-value pair, i.e., a Concept Name, encoded as a Code Sequence, and a Concept Value. The Concept Value may be encoded by any of a set of generic Attributes, as specified by a Value Type, including text, personal name, numeric, and coded concept (Code Sequence) values.

name: Content Item with Modifiers
description: Content Item with Modifiers is a means of describing structured content which needs a Content Item with single optional level of modifiers, i.e. a two-level structure of Content Items. An invocation of the Content Item with Modifiers Macro will usually specify the allowed values using a Protocol Context Template in PS3.16, which allows a single Nesting Level (see in Section 6.1.2 “Nesting Level (NL)” in PS3.16 ). Constraints on the use of this Macro may be specified in PS3.16 Annex C, which may be invoked in IODs in PS3.3.

description: Table 10-3. Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Attributes

description: Table 10-3. Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Attributes

name: Storage

name: Series and Instance Reference
description: This macro defines the Attributes that list Series and SOP Instances within those Series.

name: General Anatomy Mandatory
description: This macro , Table 10-6, Table 10-7 and Table 10-7b describe the Attributes for identifying the general region of the Patient anatomy examined using coded terminology, as well as the principal structure(s) within that region that is the target of the current SOP Instance. The only differences between the Macros are the Type and Number of Items of the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) Attribute. Table 10-8 describe the Attributes for the coding of the principal structure only.

name: General Anatomy Required
description: This macro , This macro , Table 10-7 and Table 10-7b describe the Attributes for identifying the general region of the Patient anatomy examined using coded terminology, as well as the principal structure(s) within that region that is the target of the current SOP Instance. The only differences between the Macros are the Type and Number of Items of the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) Attribute. Table 10-8 describe the Attributes for the coding of the principal structure only.

name: General Anatomy Optional
description: This macro , This macro , This macro and Table 10-7b describe the Attributes for identifying the general region of the Patient anatomy examined using coded terminology, as well as the principal structure(s) within that region that is the target of the current SOP Instance. The only differences between the Macros are the Type and Number of Items of the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) Attribute. Table 10-8 describe the Attributes for the coding of the principal structure only.

name: Multiple Site General Anatomy Optional
description: This macro , This macro , This macro and This macro describe the Attributes for identifying the general region of the Patient anatomy examined using coded terminology, as well as the principal structure(s) within that region that is the target of the current SOP Instance. The only differences between the Macros are the Type and Number of Items of the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) Attribute. Table 10-8 describe the Attributes for the coding of the principal structure only.

name: Primary Anatomic Structure
description: This macro , This macro , This macro and This macro describe the Attributes for identifying the general region of the Patient anatomy examined using coded terminology, as well as the principal structure(s) within that region that is the target of the current SOP Instance. The only differences between the Macros are the Type and Number of Items of the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) Attribute. This macro describe the Attributes for the coding of the principal structure only.

name: Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration
description: This macro defines the Attributes for the Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro.

name: SOP Instance Reference
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that reference an SOP instance.

name: Content Identification
description: This macro describe the Attributes for identifying a SOP Instance potentially created by a human user interacting with an application.

name: Enhanced Content Identification
description: The Enhanced Content Identification Macro identifies content using a label supporting lower case characters and specified character sets. If a Code String is required, see This macro .

name: Extended Content Identification
description: The Extended Content Identification Macro identifies content using a label supporting lower case characters and specified character sets. If a Code String is required, see This macro .

name: General Contributing Sources
description: This macro contains IOD Attributes that describe the general characteristics of the contributing sources used to create a new SOP Instance.

name: Contributing Image Sources
description: This macro contains IOD Attributes that describe the image related characteristics of the contributing image sources used to create a new SOP Instance (e.g., a volume SOP Instance).

name: Patient Orientation
description: This section describes Attributes of the Patient Orientation Macro by specifying the Patient orientation related to gravity and equipment. This macro contains IOD Attributes that describe the Patient Orientation related to gravity and equipment.

name: Performed Procedure Step Summary
description: Table 10-16. Performed Procedure Step Summary Macro Attributes

name: HL7v2 Hierarchic Designator
description: This macro describes the Attributes for identifying an entity (system, organization, agency, or department) that has responsibility for managing or assigning a defined set of instance identifiers (such as placer or filler number, Patient identifiers, provider identifiers, etc.). This entity could be a particular health care application such as a registration system that assigns Patient identifiers, a governmental entity such as a licensing authority that assigns professional identifiers or drivers' license numbers, or a facility where such identifiers are assigned.

name: Issuer of Patient ID
description: This macro describes the Attributes for identifying the source of Patient ID (0010,0020).

name: Algorithm Identification
description: This macro describes the Attributes for encoding the algorithm used to create or derive a SOP Instance contents. An algorithm is described by the Algorithm Family, a specific Algorithm Name, and an Algorithm Version. A character string containing parameters that were used in the algorithm can be included.

name: Selector Attribute
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that identify either a particular value of an Attribute, all values of an Attribute, a specific Item in a Sequence, or all Items in a Sequence. The Attribute or Item may be nested within one or more Sequences, and/or a Private Attribute.

name: Extended Selector Attribute
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that identify either a particular value of an Attribute, all values of an Attribute, a specific Item in a Sequence, or all Items in a Sequence. The Attribute or Item may be nested within one or more Sequences, and/or a Private Attribute.

name: Externally-Sourced Data Set Identification
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the identification of an Externally-Sourced Data Set.

name: Exposure Index
description: This macro describes the Attributes for describing the Exposure Index for single projection X-Ray images, as described by IEC 62494-1 and the report of AAPM Task Group 116.

name: Mandatory View and Slice Progression Direction
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that describe the view, and in the case of cardiac views, the direction of the slices relative to the cardiac anatomy.

name: Optional View and Slice Progression Direction
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that describe the view, and in the case of cardiac views, the direction of the slices relative to the cardiac anatomy.

name: Numeric Value
description: This macro describes the Attributes used to relate and convey a numeric value to a coded concept.

name: RT Equipment Correlation
description: Table 10-27. RT Equipment Correlation Macro Attributes Description

name: Device Motion Control
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that describe requirements on performing the movement of a device from an actual to a desired position.

name: Attribute Value Constraint
description: This macro allows an Attribute to be identified and to have constraints placed on acceptable values for that Attribute. An Attribute being constrained is refered to in the Macro as a Selector Attribute.

name: Attribute Value
description: This macro includes an Attribute to store a value of a specified VR.

name: Reference Location
description: This Macro allows a reference location in the context of a Patient or scan to be identified and described. E.g., the Macro may describe an anatomically defined location along the axis of a CT scan to prescribe the extent of a scan or reconstruction. The location might be internal to the Patient (and appear on a localizer image) or might be an external landmark (on which a laser is aligned).

name: Protocol Element Identification
description: This Macro identifies and describes an element in a protocol such as an acquisition protocol, a reconstruction protocol or a storage protocol.

name: UDI
description: This Macro records details associated with a Unique Device Identifier (UDI).

name: Assertion
description: This Macro is used to record Assertions made by a person or device about the content of a SOP Instance. The nature of the Assertion is defined by the Assertion Code.

name: Entity Labeling
description: The Entity Labeling Macro provides identification of an entity to a user.

name: Entity Long Labeling
description: The Entity Long Labeling Macro provides identification of an entity to a user.

name: Conceptual Volume
description: A Conceptual Volume is an abstract entity used to identify an anatomic region (such as a planning target volume or a combination of multiple anatomic volumes) or non-anatomic volumes such as a bolus or a marker. A Conceptual Volume can be established without necessarily defining its spatial extent (for example a Conceptual Volume for a tumor can be established prior to segmenting it). The spatial extent of a Conceptual Volume may change over time (for example as treatment proceeds the tumor volume corresponding to the Conceptual Volume will change).

name: Conceptual Volume Segmentation Reference And Combination
description: This Macro allows the combination of Conceptual Volumes as constituents of a combined volume. A representative example is to have the Left Lung and the Right Lung segmented, and then to declare the Lungs as a combined Conceptual Volume, for which prescription constraints can be defined.

name: Device Model
description: The Device Model Macro contains general Attributes needed to specify a device model other than the device creating the SOP Instance.

name: Device Identification
description: The Device Identification Macro identifies a (physical or virtual) device.

name: Related Information Entities
description: This Macro defines references to entities and their purpose of reference. References can be made at the Study level, Series level, Instance level or Frame Level.

name: Outline Definition
description: The Outline Definition Macro describes a 2D outline in a given coordinate system.

name: Patient to Equipment Relationship
description: The Patient to Equipment Relationship Macro describes a position of the patient with respect to a device. The position is defined by means of a transformation matrix between a Patient Frame of Reference and an Equipment Frame of Reference.

name: Patient Support Position
description: This Macro provides the device-specific geometric settings for the Patient Support device.

name: Patient Relationship
description: This module defines the Attributes that reference SOP Instances related to this SOP Class.

name: Patient Identification
description: This module defines the Attributes relevant to identifying a Patient.

name: Patient Demographic
description: This module defines the Attributes relevant to generally describing a Patient at a specific point in time, e.g., at the time of admission.

name: Patient Medical
description: This module defines the Attributes relevant to a Patient's medical state or history.

name: Visit Relationship
description: This module defines the Attributes that reference SOP Instances related to this SOP Class.

name: Visit Identification
description: This module defines the Attributes relevant to identifying a Visit.

name: Visit Status
description: This module defines the Attributes relevant to the Patient's stay with the healthcare provider.

name: Visit Admission
description: This module defines the Attributes relevant to admitting a Patient during a Visit.

name: Scheduled Procedure Step
description: Table C.4-10. Scheduled Procedure Step Module Attributes

name: Requested Procedure
description: Table C.4-11. Requested Procedure Module Attributes

name: Imaging Service Request
description: Table C.4-12. Imaging Service Request Module Attributes

name: Performed Procedure Step Relationship
description: This module specifies the Attributes used to reference other SOP Classes and other Information Entities of the DICOM real-world model as defined in Section 7.3.1.6.

name: Performed Procedure Step Information
description: This module defines the general Attributes that may be used by all specific Procedure Steps.

name: Image Acquisition Results
description: This module specifies Attributes that describe the acquisition of images during the performance of the Procedure Step and that provide references to the Series, Images and other Composite SOP Instances associated with this Modality Performed Procedure Step.

name: Billing and Material Management Code
description: The Attributes defined in This module provide a means to transmit billing and material management codes from a modality to an Information System. It is beyond the scope of this Standard to define all the required coding schemes and the relevant codes.

name: Instance Availability Notification
description: This module specifies the Attributes used to describe which Instances are available and their relationships.

name: Patient
description: This module specifies the Attributes of the Patient that describe and identify the Patient who is the subject of a Study. This Module contains Attributes of the Patient that are needed for interpretation of the Composite Instances and are common for all Studies performed on the Patient. It contains Attributes that are also included in the Patient Modules in Section C.2.

name: Clinical Trial Subject
description: This module contains Attributes that identify a Patient as a clinical trial or research Subject.

name: Patient Group
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Patient Group Macro that describe multiple imaging subjects (such as small animals for pre-clinical research) imaged at the same time as a group. This Macro may be included in the Section C.2.2 Patient Identification Module and the Section C.7.1.1 Patient Module.

name: General Study
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe and identify the Study performed upon the Patient.

name: Patient Study
description: This module defines Attributes that provide information about the Patient at the time the Study started.

name: Clinical Trial Study
description: This module contains Attributes that identify a Study in the context of a clinical trial or research.

name: General Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Series within a Study.

name: Clinical Trial Series
description: This module contains Attributes that identify a Series in the context of a clinical trial or research.

name: Enhanced Series
description: This module Table specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Series within a Study.

name: Frame of Reference
description: This module specifies the Attributes necessary to uniquely identify a Frame of Reference that ensures the spatial relationship of Images within a Series. It also allows Images across multiple Series to share the same Frame Of Reference. This Frame Of Reference (or coordinate system) shall be constant for all Images related to a specific Frame Of Reference.

name: Synchronization
description: This module specifies the Attributes necessary to uniquely identify a Frame of Reference that establishes the temporal relationship of SOP Instances. A synchronized environment may be established based on a shared time of day clock, and/or on a shared trigger event or synchronization waveform channel.

name: General Equipment
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe the piece of equipment that produced a Series of Composite Instances.

name: Enhanced General Equipment
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe the piece of equipment that produced a Series of Composite Instances.

name: General Image
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe an image within a particular Series.

name: Image Plane
description: This module specifies the Attributes that define the transmitted pixel array of a two dimensional image plane.

name: Image Pixel
description: This module describes the Image Pixel Module.

name: Image Pixel
description: This module describes the Image Pixel Module.

name: Image Pixel Description
description: This module describes the Image Pixel Module.

name: Contrast/Bolus
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the contrast /bolus used in the acquisition of the Image.

name: Enhanced Contrast/Bolus
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the contrast/bolus used in the acquisition of the Image.

name: Cine
description: This module specifies the Attributes of a Multi-frame Cine Image.

name: Multi-frame
description: This module specifies the Attributes of a Multi-frame pixel data Image.

name: Frame Pointers
description: This module specifies the Attributes of a Frame Pointer Module.

name: Mask
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe mask operations for a Multi-frame image.

name: Display Shutter
description: The Display shutter is a geometric mask consisting of one or more combined shapes that may be applied on the image for presentation purposes in order to neutralize the display of any of the pixels located outside of the shutter shape. Geometry of the shutter is specified with respect to a row and column coordinate system where the origin is the upper left hand pixel. This origin is specified by the values 1,1 for row/column. A row coordinate represents a row spacing (vertical) and a column coordinate represents a column spacing (horizontal). Up to three different shutter shapes may be used and superimposed.

name: Display Shutter
description: The Display shutter is a geometric mask consisting of one or more combined shapes that may be applied on the image for presentation purposes in order to neutralize the display of any of the pixels located outside of the shutter shape. Geometry of the shutter is specified with respect to a row and column coordinate system where the origin is the upper left hand pixel. This origin is specified by the values 1,1 for row/column. A row coordinate represents a row spacing (vertical) and a column coordinate represents a column spacing (horizontal). Up to three different shutter shapes may be used and superimposed.

name: Device
description: This module describes the Attributes of devices or calibration objects (e.g., catheters, markers, baskets) that are associated with a Study and/or image.

name: Intervention
description: This module describes the Attributes of therapies (e.g., interventions during an angiographic procedure) that are associated with a Study and/or image.

name: Acquisition Context
description: This module specifies Attributes for description of the conditions present during data acquisition.

name: Bitmap Display Shutter
description: The Bitmap Display Shutter is a bitmap that defines an arbitrary shape that may be applied on the image for presentation purposes in order to neutralize the display of any of the pixels defined in the bitmap.

name: Multi-frame Functional Groups
description: This module specifies the Attributes of the Multi-frame Functional Groups Module. This Module is included in SOP instances even if there is only one frame in the instance.

name: Pixel Measures
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Pixel Measures Functional Group Macro.

name: Frame Content
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Frame Content Functional Group Macro.

name: Plane Position (Patient)
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Plane Position (Patient) Functional Group Macro.

name: Plane Orientation (Patient)
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Plane Orientation (Patient) Functional Group Macro.

name: Referenced Image
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Referenced Image Functional Group Macro.

name: Derivation Image
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Derivation Image Functional Group Macro.

name: Cardiac Synchronization
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Cardiac Synchronization Functional Group Macro.

name: Frame Anatomy

name: Pixel Value Transformation
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Pixel Value Transformation Functional Group Macro.

name: Identity Pixel Value Transformation
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Identity Pixel Value Transformation Functional Group Macro.

name: Frame VOI LUT

name: Frame VOI LUT with LUT
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Frame VOI LUT With LUT Functional Group Macro. This Macro contains one or more sets of linear or sigmoid window values and/or one or more sets of lookup tables.

name: Real World Value Mapping
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Real World Value Mapping Functional Group Macro.

name: Real World Value Mapping Item
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Real World Value Mapping Functional Group Macro.

name: Contrast/Bolus Usage
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Contrast/Bolus Usage Macro.

name: Pixel Intensity Relationship LUT
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Pixel Intensity Relationship LUT Functional Group Macro.

name: Frame Pixel Shift
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Frame Pixel Shift Functional Group Macro.

name: Patient Orientation in Frame
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Patient Orientation in Frame Functional Group Macro.

name: Frame Display Shutter
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Frame Display Shutter Functional Group Macro.

name: Respiratory Synchronization
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Respiratory Synchronization Functional Group Macro.

name: Irradiation Event Identification
description: This macro specifies the Attributes containing the Irradiation Event Identification Functional Group Macro.

name: Radiopharmaceutical Usage
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Radiopharmaceutical Usage Functional Group Macro.

name: Patient Physiological State
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Patient Physiological State Functional Group Macro, which describes the physiological state of the patient.

name: Plane Position (Volume)
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Plane Position (Volume) Functional Group Macro.

name: Plane Orientation (Volume)
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Plane Orientation (Volume) Functional Group Macro.

name: Temporal Position
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Temporal Position Functional Group Macro.

name: Image Data Type
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Image Data Type Functional Group Macro.

name: Unassigned Shared Converted Attributes
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Unassigned Shared Converted Attributes Functional Group Macro.

name: Unassigned Per-Frame Converted Attributes
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Unassigned Per-Frame Converted Attributes Functional Group Macro.

name: Image Frame Conversion Source
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Image Frame Conversion Source Functional Group Macro.

name: Stored Value Color Range
description: This macro defines the Attributes of the Stored Value Color Range Functional Group Macro

name: Frame Usefulness Functional Group
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Frame Usefulness Functional Group Macro, related to the clinical usefulness of the current frame.

name: Camera Position Functional Group
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Camera Position Functional Group Macro, related to the position of the camera or the acquisition device for the current frame, with regards to the patient.

name: Time of Frame Functional Group
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Time of Frame Functional Group Macro, related to the time of frame.

name: Multi-frame Dimension
description: The This module contains a Sequence with Items pointing to Attributes defining a set of dimensions that are usually known prior to the acquisition commencing. It is up to the generating applications to decide what Attributes are important to describe the multi-frame dimensions.

name: Cardiac Synchronization
description: This module specifies the Attributes of the Cardiac Synchronization Module.

name: Respiratory Synchronization
description: This module specifies the Attributes of the Respiratory Synchronization Module.

name: Bulk Motion Synchronization
description: This module specifies the Attributes of the Bulk Motion Synchronization Module.

name: Supplemental Palette Color Lookup Table
description: This Module is used in conjunction with Multi-frame IODs that use RGB color in a number of frames. The value of Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) for such frames equals COLOR.

name: Patient Orientation
description: This section describes Attributes of the Patient Orientation Module by describing the patient orientation related to gravity and equipment. This module contains IOD Attributes that describe the Patient Orientation.

name: Image - Equipment Coordinate Relationship
description: This section describes the Image - Equipment Coordinate Relationship Module. This module contains the Attributes that specify how the equipment (e.g., gantry) and patient oriented coordinate system (in conjunction with Image Position (Patient) (0020,0032) and Image Orientation (Patient) (0020,0037) Attributes) are related.

name: Specimen
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify one or more Specimens being imaged.

name: Specimen
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify one or more Specimens being imaged.

name: Enhanced Palette Color Lookup Table
description: This module specifies the Attributes that define data flow through the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline. See Section C.7.6.23.1 for an overview of the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline.

name: Floating Point Image Pixel
description: This module describes the Floating Point Image Pixel Module. This Module differs from the Section C.7.6.3 Image Pixel Module in that:

name: Double Floating Point Image Pixel
description: This module describes the Double Floating Point Image Pixel Module. This Module differs from the Section C.7.6.3 Image Pixel Module in that:

name: Real-Time Bulk Data Flow
description: This module references pixels/waveforms that are not contained within the DICOM dataset but conveyed in the associated Flows, as described in Section 6.1 in PS3.22 .

name: Current Frame Functional Groups
description: This module defines the Attributes related to the current frame when the IOD is transported using Real-Time Communication. It corresponds to the "per-frame" Attribute for the non-Real-Time IODs.

name: Real-Time Acquisition
description: This module defines the Attributes related to all frames when the IOD is transported using Real-Time Communication.

name: Palette Color Lookup Table
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Lookup table data for images with Palette Color photometric interpretation.

name: Palette Color Lookup Table
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Lookup table data for images with Palette Color photometric interpretation.

name: CR Series
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe a computed radiography Series performed on the patient.

name: CR Image
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe computed radiography images.

name: CT Image
description: The table in this Section contains IOD Attributes that describe CT images.

name: Multi-energy CT Image
description: The table in this Section contains IOD Attributes that describe a Multi-energy CT image.

name: Multi-energy CT X-Ray Source
description: Attributes for the CT X-Ray Source(s).

name: Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector
description: Attributes for the CT X-Ray Detector(s).

name: Multi-energy CT Path
description: A Multi-energy CTPath is an X-Ray source paired with a corresponding X-Ray detector for a particular energy level.

name: MR Image
description: This module contains the Attributes that describe MR images.

name: NM/PET Patient Orientation
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the NM/PET Patient Orientation.

name: NM Image Pixel
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the pixel data of a NM image.

name: NM Multi-frame
description: This module specifies the Attributes of a NM Multi-frame Image. This Module is always included in a NM SOP instance, even if there is only one frame in the image.

name: NM Image
description: This module contains the Attributes that describe Nuclear Medicine Images.

name: NM Isotope
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the isotope administered for the acquisition.

name: NM Detector
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe Nuclear Medicine Detectors used to produce an image.

name: NM Tomo Acquisition
description: This Module applies to a TOMO Multi-frame Image. This Module is present when Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3, is equal to TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO, or RECON GATED TOMO. The elements found in this Module describe the acquisition of the Image.

name: NM Multi-Gated Acquisition
description: This module contains Attributes that describe a multi-gated acquisition image performed on the patient. This refers to frames acquired while the patient is connected to a gating device.

name: NM Phase
description: This module contains Attributes that describe dynamic phases of a dynamic acquisition image performed on the patient. This Module is present only when Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is equal to DYNAMIC. A phase is defined as a collection of frames in which the acquisition time per frame and the time delay between frames remains constant. A new phase shall be defined whenever there is a change in the time between frames, the acquisition time per frame, or the position of the patient relative to the detector.

name: NM Reconstruction
description: This module contains Attributes that describe Nuclear Medicine reconstructed volumes. Reconstructed volumes are created by applying a transformation (reconstruction) process to the acquired TOMO frames. This Module is present only when Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is equal to RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

name: US Region Calibration
description: The US Region Calibration Module has been introduced into the ultrasound IOD to provide access to the full range of data that may be present in a single US image. US images often contain multiple regions that have independent data regions, e.g., quad screen loops that may have different calibration information. The data presented in the various regions of a US image can represent a multiplicity of physical parameters, e.g., spatial distance, blood velocity, time, volume, etc., and these are often contained in the value of the pixel itself. It is therefore imperative that physical information be available for the various regions of a single region independent of each other.

name: US Image
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe ultrasound images.

name: SC Equipment
description: This Module describes equipment used to convert images into a DICOM format.

name: SC Image
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe Secondary Capture Images.

name: SC Multi-frame Image
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe SC Multi-frame images.

name: SC Multi-frame Vector
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that may be the target of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) for SC Multi-frame images.

name: X-Ray Image
description: Table C.8-26. X-Ray Image Module Attributes

name: X-Ray Acquisition
description: Table C.8-27. X-Ray Acquisition Module Attributes

name: X-Ray Collimator
description: An X-Ray Collimator is a device placed close to the X-Ray Source to restrict the span of the X-Ray beam. It is often made of lead shutters. This module presents in a graphical form its relationship with the Field Of View Dimensions (0018,1149).

name: X-Ray Collimator Dimensions
description: An X-Ray Collimator is a device placed close to the X-Ray Source to restrict the span of the X-Ray beam. It is often made of lead shutters. This module presents in a graphical form its relationship with the Field Of View Dimensions (0018,1149).

name: X-Ray Table
description: This module contains Attributes that describe X-Ray images acquired with movement of the patient imaging table.

name: XA Positioner
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe a c-arm positioner typically used in acquiring X-Ray Angiographic Images. The coordinate system used to track the positioner is defined in reference to the patient. The definition of coordinates with respect to the equipment is not supported. Furthermore, this Module does not describe the movement of the patient.

name: XRF Positioner
description: Table C.8-31. XRF Positioner Module Attributes

name: X-Ray Tomography Acquisition
description: This Module describes the Attributes of a Tomography acquisition (translation of X-Ray source during the acquisition of a single-frame image).

name: X-Ray Acquisition Dose
description: This Module describes the Attributes related to dose delivery from an X-Ray source during the acquisition of an X-Ray image.

name: X-Ray Generation
description: This Module describes the Attributes related to generation of X-Rays during the acquisition of an X-Ray image.

name: X-Ray Filtration
description: This Module describes the Attributes related to the filtration of X-Rays during the acquisition of an X-Ray image.

name: X-Ray Filtration

name: RT Series
description: There exist significant differences in the manner in which RT objects as compared to diagnostic objects. An RT object can be one of several types, and a series of a given object type may be created over a temporal span of several weeks. The This module has been created to satisfy the requirements of the standard DICOM Query/Retrieve model while including only those Attributes relevant to the identification and selection of radiotherapy objects.

name: RT Image
description: This module contains Attributes that describe RT-specific characteristics of a projection image. The image described by these Attributes must be a radiotherapy image acquired or calculated using a conical imaging geometry.

name: RT Dose
description: The This module is used to convey 2D or 3D radiation dose data generated from treatment planning systems or similar devices. The Attributes defined within the Module support dose for a single radiation beam (potentially comprised of multiple segments, as delivered in a dynamic treatment) or a group of beams comprising either a fraction group (see Section C.8.8.13) or a complete treatment plan (potentially the sum of multiple fraction groups).

name: RT DVH
description: The This module provides for the inclusion of differential or cumulative dose volume histogram data. The data contained within this Module may supplement dose data in the RT Dose Module and/or RT Dose ROI Module, or it may be present in the absence of other dose data.

name: Structure Set
description: A structure set defines a set of areas of significance. Each area can be associated with a Frame of Reference and zero or more images. Information that can be transferred with each region of interest (ROI) includes geometrical and display parameters, and generation technique.

name: ROI Contour
description: In general, a ROI can be defined by either a sequence of overlays or a sequence of contours. This Module, if present, is used to define the ROI as a set of contours. Each ROI contains a sequence of one or more contours, where a contour is either a single point (for a point ROI) or more than one point (representing an open or closed polygon).

name: RT Dose ROI
description: RT Dose ROI provides ancillary dose-related information to the ROI data defined within the This module and ROI Contour Module, which may be included in the RT Dose IOD composite object. These Modules in combination provide for the definition of dose data in the form of isodose curves or named or unnamed dose points. Isodose curves in radiation oncology are simply contours identifying a set of points with the same dose value.

name: RT ROI Observations
description: The RT ROI Observations Module specifies the identification and interpretation of an ROI specified in the This module and ROI Contour Module.

name: RT Patient Setup
description: The This module contains information describing the positioning of the patient with respect to the treatment machine, along with any fixation devices used. It also describes the shielding devices applied to the patient. The Module contains a Sequence of patient setup descriptions, each of which may be referenced by one of more beams or brachy application setups.

name: RT Fraction Scheme
description: The This module contains Attributes that describe a single or multiple scheme of dose descriptions. Each Sequence Item contains dose specification information, fractionation patterns, and either beam or brachytherapy application setup specifications. The design of the RT Fraction Scheme Module allows a beam or brachytherapy application setup to be used in multiple fraction schemes.

name: RT Beams
description: The This module contains information defining equipment parameters for delivery of external radiation beams.

name: RT Brachy Application Setups
description: The This module describes the application of a brachytherapy radiotherapy treatment. It contains one or more sources, each associated with one or more Channels. A Channel is a device by which a source is placed in its intended treatment position or positions. A Channel may consist of a Source Applicator plus a Transfer Tube, a Source Applicator alone, a rigid or flexible linear source, or a seed. A number of Channels (for example applicators, sources or seeds) are generally arranged in an Application Setup, which may be considered a "logical" device. It is important not to confuse Application Setup with Applicator. The model used here has been primarily built around the concept of remote afterloading, but extended to support other brachytherapy applications such as manual applicators and molds, seeds, and sources. Additional devices that are not Channels are described as Brachy Accessory Devices. Examples of Accessory Devices include shields that modify the dose distribution from all sources in the treatment. However, Channel shields modify the dose only for the source(s) in that Channel.

description: The Excluded Intervals Module indicates those periods within Acquisition Duration (0018,9073) during which no volume acquisition takes place. description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Cylinder Sequence Macro

name: Prism Sequence
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Prism Sequence Macro

name: General Ophthalmic Refractive Measurements
description: This module defines the General Ophthalmic Refractive Measurements Module Attributes.

name: Lensometry Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to capture the refractive measurements by a lensometer for spectacles. This is typically for a pair of lenses, but sometimes for just one. Sometimes a single lens is measured with an unknown laterality.

name: Lensometry Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to capture the refractive measurements by a lensometer for spectacles. This is typically for a pair of lenses, but sometimes for just one. Sometimes a single lens is measured with an unknown laterality.

name: Autorefraction Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the refractive measurements by an autorefractor of a patient's eyes. Usually both eyes are measured, but sometimes just one.

name: Keratometry Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the keratometric measurements by a keratometer of a patient's eyes. Usually both eyes are measured, but sometimes just one.

name: Keratometric Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the keratometric measurements by a keratometer of a patient's eyes. Usually both eyes are measured, but sometimes just one.

name: Subjective Refraction Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the subjective refractive measurements of a patient's eyes. Usually both eyes are measured, but sometimes just one.

name: Subjective Refraction Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the subjective refractive measurements of a patient's eyes. Usually both eyes are measured, but sometimes just one.

name: Visual Acuity Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the subjective measurements of a patient's visual acuity. Usually each eye is measured individually, but sometimes only one eye is measured; sometimes the visual acuity of both eyes working together is measured. The visual acuity may be measured uncorrected, or with various refractive corrections, such as best corrected distance, pinhole, habitual near, etc

name: Visual Acuity Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the subjective measurements of a patient's visual acuity. Usually each eye is measured individually, but sometimes only one eye is measured; sometimes the visual acuity of both eyes working together is measured. The visual acuity may be measured uncorrected, or with various refractive corrections, such as best corrected distance, pinhole, habitual near, etc

name: Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Series.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to encode axial measurements of the eye made by an axial measurements device. This is typically done for both eyes, but may be for just one.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Measurements
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Macro.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Length Segmental Measurements
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Axial Length Segmental Measurements Macro.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Related Information
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Related Information Macro.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Selected
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Selected Macro. These are the Attributes of the Ophthalmic Axial Length (0022,1019) selected for use in IOL calculations.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Length Quality Metric
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Axial Length Quality Metric Macro.

name: Intraocular Lens Calculations Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Intraocular Lens Calculations Series.

name: Intraocular Lens Calculations
description: This module defines the Attributes used to calculate the power of an intraocular lens to be placed in a patient's eye. This is typically done for both eyes for comparison, but may be for just one eye. Values used may be measurements acquired using the axial length measurements device, manually entered, or derived from a referenced SOP class or other data source.

name: Intraocular Lens Calculations
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Intraocular Lens Calculations Macro.

name: Keratometry
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Keratometry Macro.

name: IOL Ophthalmic Axial Length
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the IOL Ophthalmic Axial Length Macro.

name: Calculated IOL
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Calculated IOL Macro.

name: Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Quality Image SOP Instance Reference
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Axial Measurements Quality Image SOP Instance Reference Macro

name: Calculated Toric Power
description: This macro specifies and describes the attributes that identify the toric amount of calculated refractive power used in IOL calculation.

name: Cornea Measurement
description: This macro specifies and describes the attributes for the Cornea Measurement Macro used in IOL calculation.

name: Visual Field Static Perimetry Measurements Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Visual Field Static Perimetry Measurements Series.

name: Visual Field Static Perimetry Test Parameters
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the parameters used during a patient's visual field test.

name: Visual Field Static Perimetry Test Reliability
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the test reliability parameters determined during a patient's visual field test.

name: Ophthalmic Visual Field Global Index
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Visual Field Global Index Macro.

name: Visual Field Static Perimetry Test Measurements
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent the test measurement values determined during a patient's visual field test.

name: Visual Field Static Perimetry Test Results
description: This module defines the Attributes used to interpret the test results of a patient's visual field test.

name: Ophthalmic Patient Clinical Information and Test Lens Parameters
description: This module defines the Attributes used to represent a patient's clinical parameters during an ophthalmic test.

name: Ophthalmic Patient Clinical Information and Test Lens Parameters
description: This macro describes the Attributes for the Ophthalmic Patient Clinical and Test Lens Parameters Macro.

name: Intravascular OCT Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Intravascular Optical Coherence Tomography Series.

name: Intravascular OCT Image
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe an Image produced by Intravascular OCT imaging modalities.

name: Intravascular OCT Acquisition Parameters
description: This module describes the parameters used to acquire an Intravascular Optical Coherence Tomography image.

name: Intravascular OCT Processing Parameters
description: This module describes the parameters used for processing an Intravascular Optical Coherence Tomography polar data image.

name: Intravascular Image Acquisition Parameters
description: This module describes the parameters and characteristics of an intravascular image acquisition. These parameters are common to both IVUS and IVOCT.

name: Intravascular OCT Frame Type
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Intravascular OCT Frame Type Functional Group.

name: Intravascular Frame Content
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Intravascular Frame Content Functional Group.

name: Intravascular OCT Frame Content
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Intravascular OCT Frame Content Functional Group.

name: Ophthalmic Thickness Map Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Ophthalmic Thickness Map Series.

name: Ophthalmic Thickness Map
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe an Image produced by ophthalmic thickness mapping devices.

name: Ophthalmic Thickness Map Quality Rating
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the quality rating for the ophthalmic mapping.

name: Optical Surface Scanner Series
description: This module contains IOD Attributes that describe an optical surface scan Series performed on the patient.

name: Scan Procedure
description: This module specifies the Attributes of the Scan Procedure Module.

name: Corneal Topography Map Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Corneal Topography Map Series.

name: Corneal Topography Map Image
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe an Image produced by corneal topography mapping devices.

name: Corneal Topography Map Analysis
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the corneal Topography map analysis.

name: Enhanced Mammography Image
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about the Enhanced Mammography Image Module.

name: Breast X-Ray Positioner
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Breast X-Ray Positioner Functional Group Macro.

name: Breast X-Ray Detector
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Breast X-Ray Detector Functional Group Macro.

name: Breast X-Ray Geometry
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Breast X-Ray Geometry Functional Group Macro.

name: Breast X-Ray Acquisition Dose
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the X-Ray Acquisition Dose Functional Group Macro.

name: Breast X-Ray Isocenter Reference System
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Breast X-Ray Isocenter Reference System Functional Group Macro.

name: X-Ray Grid
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the X-Ray Grid Functional Group Macro.

name: X-Ray Filter
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the X-Ray Filter Functional Group Macro.

name: Parametric Map Series
description: This module defines the general Attributes of the Parametric Map Series Module.

name: Parametric Map Image
description: This module defines the general Attributes of the Parametric Map Image Module.

name: Parametric Map Frame Type
description: This macro specifies the Attributes of the Parametric Map Frame Type Functional Group Macro.

name: Tractography Results Series
description: This module specifies the Attributes that identify and describe general information about a Tractography Results Series.

name: Tractography Results
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the tracks and measurements in the tractography results.

name: Table Summary Statistics
description: This Macro encodes summary statistics derived from a set of values.

name: Overlay Plane
description: This module contains Attributes that describe characteristics of an Overlay Plane.

name: Multi-frame Overlay
description: This module specifies the Attributes of a Multi-frame overlay.

name: Displayed Area
description: This Module describes Attributes required to define a Specified Displayed Area space.

name: Graphic Annotation
description: This Module defines Attributes of vector graphics and text annotation that shall be made available by a display device to be applied to an image. The graphics and text are defined in position and size relative to the image pixel coordinates or the Specified Displayed Area space (defined in This module ); in the context of a Volumetric Presentation State IOD, the annotation is relative to the Volumetric Presentation View (e.g., the MPR view defined in Section C.11.26). A Graphic Annotation shall be related to an Image.

name: Text Style Sequence
description: Text Style Sequence (0070,0231) contains the text style for each text object. This Attribute gives recommendations on how the annotation text should be rendered at the display.

name: Line Style Sequence
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that describe Line Style Sequence Macro.

name: Fill Style Sequence
description: This macro specifies the Attributes that describe Fill Style Sequence Macro.

name: Spatial Transformation
description: This Module defines a manner of rotating an image by increments of ninety degrees and flipping an image.

name: Graphic Layer
description: This Module defines the characteristics of the layers in which overlays, graphic and text may be rendered.

name: Waveform Identification
description: The table in this section contains Attributes that identify a Waveform as a separate information entity.

name: Waveform
description: The table in this section contains Attributes that describe a time-based waveform. A waveform consists of one or more multiplex groups, each encoded into an Item in the Waveform Sequence. All channels within a multiplex group are synchronously digitized at a common sampling frequency.

name: Waveform Annotation
description: The table in this section contains Attributes that identify annotations to the waveform of the current SOP Instance. Each annotation conceptually forms the equivalent of a overlay on a presentation display of the annotated entity. Annotations may represent a measurement or categorization based on the waveform data, identification of regions of interest or particular features of the waveform, or events during the data collection that may affect diagnostic interpretation (e.g., the time at which the subject coughed).

name: Graphic Group
description: Graphic Group Module provides the label and description for the logical associations made by the Graphic Group ID (0070,0295) of graphic objects.

name: Modality LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Modality LUT.

name: Modality LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Modality LUT.

name: VOI LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the VOI LUT.

name: VOI LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the VOI LUT.

name: Presentation LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Presentation LUT.

name: Image Histogram
description: Table C.11.5-1. Image Histogram Module Attributes

name: Softcopy Presentation LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Softcopy Presentation LUT.

name: Overlay Activation
description: This Module defines a manner of controlling whether or not bit-mapped overlay and curve information are displayed.

name: Softcopy VOI LUT
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe the Softcopy VOI LUT. These Attributes have the same meaning and behavior as defined in the Section C.11.2 VOI LUT Module.

name: Presentation Series
description: This module contains Attributes that identify and describe a Presentation Series.

name: Presentation State Identification
description: This module contains Attributes that identify a Presentation State.

name: Presentation State Relationship
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the images to which a Presentation State applies.

name: Presentation State Relationship
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the images to which a Presentation State applies.

name: Presentation State Shutter
description: This module contains Attributes that specialize Attributes in other Modules included in a Presentation State.

name: Presentation State Mask
description: This module contains Attributes that specialize the use of masks in a Presentation State.

name: Presentation State Blending
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the identification of two sets of grayscale images and the grayscale transformations to be applied to them, for the purpose of blending.

name: ICC Profile
description: This module contains Attributes that identify and describe an ICC Profile.

name: Structured Display
description: This module describes the Attributes of the Structured Display Module.

name: Structured Display Image Box
description: This module describes the Attributes of the Structured Display Image Box Module.

name: Structured Display Annotation
description: This Module defines Attributes of text annotation that shall be applied to a Structured Display. The text is defined in position and size relative to the Display Environment.

name: XA/XRF Presentation State Mask
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe mask operations for a XA/XRF Multi-frame image.

name: XA/XRF Presentation State Shutter
description: This module specifies the Attributes that describe shutter operations for a XA/XRF Multi-frame image.

name: XA/XRF Presentation State Presentation
description: This module specifies the Attributes of a XA/XRF Presentation State Presentation Module.

name: Volumetric Presentation State Identification
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the volume view type of this Presentation State.

name: Volumetric Presentation State Relationship
description: This module contains Attributes that describe sets of inputs to a Presentation State and how each input is to be displayed in the presentation.

name: Volume Cropping
description: This module contains the Attributes of the Volume Cropping Module. This Module limits the spatial extent of inputs in Volumetric Presentation State Input Sequence (0070,1201) that are used.

name: Presentation View Description
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the view of this presentation in anatomical terms.

name: Multi-Planar Reconstruction Geometry
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the geometry of this Multi-Planar Reconstruction view.

name: MPR Volumetric Presentation State Display
description: This module specifies the Attributes that define the transformations of the processed MPR Volumetric Presentation State inputs into a single VPS display space, as described in the Volumetric Presentation State pipeline in Section FF.2.1 “Volumetric Transformations” in PS3.4.

name: Volumetric Graphic Annotation
description: This module contains Attributes that specify graphic annotation placed in the Volumetric Presentation State Reference Coordinate System coordinate space.

name: Presentation Animation
description: This module contains Attributes that describe animation of the presentation.

name: Volume Render Geometry
description: This module contains Attributes that describe the geometry of the volume rendered view.

name: Render Shading
description: Shading enhances the visual perception of a volume by adding reflection characteristics.

name: Render Display
description: This module specifies the Attributes that define the transformations of the processed Volumetric Presentation State inputs into a single VPS display space, as described in the Volumetric Presentation State pipelines in Section FF.2.2 “Volumetric Inputs, Registration and Cropping” in PS3.4.

name: Advanced Blending Presentation State
description: This module contains Attributes that describe one or more inputs optionally one or more sets of registration objects, and the color and thresholds to be applied to them, for the purpose of blending.

name: Threshold Sequence
description: The Threshold Sequence is defining the values of the image that are used or ignored.

name: Advanced Blending Presentation State Display
description: The Advanced Blending Presentation State Display Module specifies the input and the method used for each blending step.

name: SOP Common
description: This module defines the Attributes that are required for proper functioning and identification of the associated SOP Instances. They do not specify any semantics about the Real-World Object represented by the IOD.

name: Digital Signatures
description: This Macro allows Digital Signatures to be included in a DICOM Data Set for the purpose of insuring the integrity of the Data Set, and to authenticate the sources of the Data Set. This macro defines the Attributes needed to embed a Digital Signature in a Data Set. This Macro may appear in individual Sequence Items as well as in the top level Data Set of the SOP Instance.

name: Common Instance Reference
description: This module defines the Attributes that describe the hierarchical relationships of any SOP Instances referenced from other Modules within the Instance in which this Module occurs.

name: Frame Extraction
description: This module defines the Attributes that describe the frames extracted if the SOP Instance was created in response to a Frame-Level retrieve request.

name: General Reference
description: This module specifies the Attributes that reference source and other related instances and describe the manner of derivation.

name: Timezone
description: This module defines the Attributes that are required for proper functioning and identification of the timezone within which an Instance was created.

name: Basic Film Session Presentation
description: Table C.13-1. Basic Film Session Presentation Module Attributes

name: Basic Film Session Relationship
description: Table C.13-2. Basic Film Session Relationship Module Attributes
